page.title: 15RELIGION IN OFFLEY.
page.content: There is a chapel in the village but it is no longer in use as the few people who worshipped there can no longer afford its upkeep and the site is likely to be put up for sale. The Roman Catholics hold a monthly service in the Church of England which is dedicated to Mary Magdalene. There is no longer a Sunday School in the village and few of the young people go to church . The school is governed by members of the Parochial Church Council and upholds the Christian Traditions and beliefs as well as teaching "Religious Education" which includes the beliefs and customs of other world religions. The vicarage in Offley has been sold and there is no longer a Vicar of Offley only a Priest in Charge.
